items.title: Bharti Airtel shares in focus on partnership with Starlink; JPMorgan says stock can rally 66%
items.description: The SpaceX team said, 'We are excited to work with Airtel and unlock the transformative impact Starlink can bring to the people of India.'

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty signals a flat start; US stocks fall, Asia gains
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: US stocks fell on Tuesday, adding to the biggest selloff in months, as investors worried about the impact of the latest tariff threats on the global economy. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 478.23 points, or 1.14%, to 41,433.48, the S&P 500 lost 42.49 points, or 0.76%, to 5,572.07 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 32.23 points, or 0.18%, to 17,436.10.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) continued their selling on March 11 as they sold equities worth Rs 2,823 crore. On the other hand, domestic institutional investors (DIIs) continued their buying as they bought equities of more than Rs 2,000 crore, on the same day.

items.title: Live: How Will Nifty React To Trump’s New Tariff Shock? Starlink Partners with Airtel |Opening Bell
items.description: US stocks declined on Tuesday, extending the steepest selloff in months, as investors grappled with concerns over the potential economic fallout from new tariff threats. Market volatility was high, driven by conflicting updates on tariffs, while brief optimism over progress toward a Ukraine-Russia ceasefire provided a temporary boost to equities. The S&P 500 fell to an intraday low of 5,528.41, briefly entering a market correction with a 10% decline from its record close of 6,144.15 on February 19. President Donald Trump announced plans to double tariffs on all imported Canadian steel and aluminum products to 50%, just hours before they were set to take effect, but soon backtracked. Asian markets are trading mixed and the GIFT Nifty is trading marginally in the red. The Nifty made a good recovery from day’s low to edge back near the 22,500 mark. Watch out for IndusInd Bank after the stock crashed 27% yesterday, also in focus will be Bharti Airtel & PB Fintech. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Rajesh Palviya, Senior Vice President Research (Head Technical & Derivatives) at Axis Securities and Sandeep Bagla, CEO, TRUST Mutual Fund.
